body:
Travis failures:

```
whisk.core.controller.test.ActionsApiTests > Actions API should invoke an action, blocking FAILED
whisk.core.controller.test.ActionsApiTests > Actions API should invoke a blocking action and return error response when activation fails FAILED
```

are related to this change; the test was overriding the value of the activation id with a stub which no longer works when lifting `poll` up. Might require a different testing strategy (e.g., refactoring code to use an activation id factory which the test can then override with predetermined ids).

Note that we don't have a test for the active ack path - we should add one.
Tabs removed and merged as https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/commit/43a0b306e723363a9a2d87569c56059d6a44e0e8.

Made the suggested change.

Merged as https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/commit/9882e3ad61f9d614ecd27e661dbba41e386842ea.

This test failed in the past a few times. On looking into it, we realized that the action was killed after one minute in the invoker. That's why we increased the timeout-limit of the action in this test.
@rabbah I made some minor edits to the README and opened a PR directly to your fork here: https://github.com/rabbah/openwhisk/pull/1
Went through procedure to create starterapp.  I cannot replicate this.  Try hard clean?  You may have cached module from previous version of SDK.
@rabbah, could we have had a test that would have discovered this issue?
This is a transitional state because we will eventually delete the pipe file and then the issue would be discovered.  However, the UI was (is?) still depending on this.  @starpit - can you confirm?
correct, the UI right now still uses the old pipe implementation.
we can add a test that does `wsk action create --sequence` followed by `wsk action get` and confirm the schema is the new one (`exec kind` is `sequence`, has `components`, and there is no `pipe`).
Can you add the test alluded to here: https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/issues/1057#issuecomment-240458764?

Do we have any reason to believe 2 minutes is better than 1?

It seems more likely that the action is hanging rather than just slow, right?
Related to #903.

Code looks good. Can we take the opportunity to remove the synchronous clients? IIRC last time I did it locally it "only" meant making sure an `ActorSystem` was available by the time the first configuration object is created.
Did a hard clean still didn't fix it

@paulcastro  Paul and I think that increasing from 1 to 2 minute will not make a difference.

Generally, we increase the timeout only when there is evidence that giving more time would actually help such as when we see that the invoker wrote something to the db but that it took too long for it to show up for the polling.  If the action never finished as far as the invoker is concerned, that increasing the poll period will not change anything.
Will do.

After working with @paulcastro it looks the `pod install` is not picking the latest version `0.1.6`

it's picking up `0.1.3`

```
$ pod install
Analyzing dependencies
Downloading dependencies
Installing OpenWhisk (0.1.3)
Generating Pods project
Integrating client project
```

leaving open as more investigation is ongoing, maybe we pinned the Podfile to specific version

Today packages serve two purposes "grouping" and "binding"
We should down the road on creating first class entities for the different usages.
Maybe using "tags" as a way to group assets (i.e. actions, rules, sequences, triggers)
Maybe using "bindings" as a way to store credentials or configuration information that can be manage and reuse apply to any of the (actions).

Just bringing this up as it might be something to add to v2

Just to note, this issue is specific to the local dev environment, I haven't seen this problem in mine.    Its best to pin the SDK version in the Podfile regardless so its explicit what version the starter app is using.  That will make it clearer if the developer's pod install is not installing the required version.
Issue reproduced in a unit test. Note that `Class.forName("second.class.name")` selects the right classloader and works.
@psuter `ConsulKV` nuked!
Looks good, thanks!

I will revert the change and only change the test suite name as discussed with @jeremiaswerner 

PG 204 is green

@dubeejw , if I remove the setupClientConfig call in property.go, when I run the 
wsk property set --apihost="ng.bluemix.net"
I got the error:
runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
Application exited unexpectedly

I guess that's the client not initialized, is that correct, I reviewed the CI failed log, I found part of
the reason is related to this.
@perryibm see comment above for a list of successful PG1 builds.
PG1 205 in progress

On writing the test I had the problem, that the message has not been fetched again from Kafka if the commit failed. I also did some experiments with the “enabale.auto.commit” setting, but it still didn’t work.
So I changed the order of committing and processing again and added a check to the test, that the message is only processed once.

PG 206 is green.
PG 207
@markusthoemmes, did our fix not work?
Waiting for verification.
rebased and merged in d3a297d143827eff6a40c46c59e7cf6c455bc738
rebased and merged in f19c13f34fae271731e2daa1e03292ce3075bd95
@psuter testcases added

I'm hitting the same error if I try to create a rule where the action is in a package.

$wsk rule create --enable nlcTrainingRule nlcTrainingTrigger cloudbot/nlcTrainer
error: The request content was malformed:
entity name malformed (code 1015467)

I'm able to create the rule if the action is not in a package.
You may filter activation by name. From the cli or directly against the API.

Thanks Rabbah, 
I got it, by using name parameter !
@dubeejw @mdeuser any ideas what's could be wrong here?
+1 to generating bash auto conf to stdout. Could add -o  to write it to a file.
personal preference is by default to do STDOUT always, to have an option to output to a file, not necessary, user can always redirect the output to a file.
I suspect (i.e. Goole and StackOverFlow 😸 ) I need to install `bash-completion@1.3+` but I don't see it in the help as a requirement, maybe script can be smart enough to tell me when I source it

Workaround at least for Mac is install `bash-completion`, don't know for Linux this is something that has a good chance to be already installed

```
🍔  $ brew install bash-completion
==> Downloading https://homebrew.bintray.com/bottles/bash-completion-1.3_1.el_capitan.bottle.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Pouring bash-completion-1.3_1.el_capitan.bottle.1.tar.gz
==> Caveats
Add the following lines to your ~/.bash_profile:
  if [ -f $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion ]; then
    . $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion
  fi

Bash completion has been installed to:
  /usr/local/etc/bash_completion.d
==> Summary
🍺  /usr/local/Cellar/bash-completion/1.3_1: 188 files, 605.9K
🍔  $   if [ -f $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion ]; then
>     . $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion
>   fi
🍔  $ cd
🍔  $ source wsk_cli_bash_completion.sh
🍔  $ wsk action
create  delete  get     invoke  list    update
```
PG1 218 was good.

Apparently, bash must be at version >= 4.1 for bash-completion to work.  Docker CLI uses Cobra to generate it's bash-completion script as well.  For Mac, they recommend installing manually installing bash-completion as you mentioned above via `brew install bash-completion` since Mac currently ships bash version 3.2
https://docs.docker.com/compose/completion/

Most recent Linux distributions should have the correct version of bash.

Thanks @mdeuser 

```
$ bash --version
GNU bash, version 3.2.57(1)-release (x86_64-apple-darwin15)
Copyright (C) 2007 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
```

It looks Mac El Capitan version is 3.2 lower than 4.1

For those that want to edit their `~/profile` and `~/bashrc`
He is the workaround that I have for now

```
pushd $(mktemp -d) > /dev/null && wsk sdk install bashauto > /dev/null && source wsk_cli_bash_completion.sh && popd > /dev/null
```
Good catch, thanks for surfacing that. This is due to all activations going to the users default namespace (`_`) currently. We got it on our list to fix.
@kurtismgit Refer to #239 which describes your issue exactly.

I'm a new OpenWhisk user (1 week or so) and hit this pretty quickly.  As you know the error wasn't helpful.  Found myself searching through github issues to figure out about this limitation.  Definitely have my vote for fixing it.
PG1 219 is good.

PG1#226 started
Test to check if failover to active polling and test if timeout is working are added.

Is the threading of `ActivationId` done for testing? (Many of @markusthoemmes' comments above are related to this.) If so, a cleaner option is to define an activation id factory in the backend services trait which is called to get a new activation id instead of ActivationId(). Then the test will override this trait to issue an activation id as needed for tests.
@rabbah rebased and repassed test
@paulcastro Ah you found the solution 👍
LGTM

Validated locally 

```
$ xcodebuild -list -workspace OpenWhiskStarterApp.xcworkspace
Information about workspace "OpenWhiskStarterApp":
    Schemes:
        OpenWhisk
        OpenWhisk-OpenWhiskResources
        OpenWhiskStarterApp
        Pods-OpenWhiskStarterApp
```
rebase and merged 294d0f2d8b59a584671f879ccc6da4f2f254c075
What about these [tests](https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/tree/master/tests/src/actionContainers) which assume the prefix is `whisk`.
Merged as https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/commit/e5cf3c1806b8c1ed2f3dfaba24f9aacedfe81f90.
very nice refactoring of the tests - some small issues left also the go cli issue with sequences is now fixed.
Merged as https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/compare/e5cf3c1806b8...2895a9626c84.
Merged as https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/commit/a6f6a5c5037e37352117becaad79438974db7a9d.
Adding tests to confirm actions have expected environment available. Also going to refactor some of the common tests to reduce clone and own.
I will work on updating the docs to reflect the changes
LGTM, do we need to rebase?  pbxproj files etc have changed.
Merged  PR #1078
Migrating this issue to iOS SDK since this is not specifically a starter app issue.

The `ActivationThrottle` reads all the activations from consul anyway. It got recently promoted into the Controller code directly. I think it's very simple to add a method there where the controller could potentially ask for system-overload.

We need to talk about this before implementing it -- in particular, I think we want to encourage caching of large static read-only data structures to reduce initialization work -- this proposal would make that more difficult.

Also I'm not convinced yet that "cleansing" is easy or even feasible.     Who knows what side effects actions (i.e. libraries they call) may have somewhere?

For these reasons, I'm scared.     I'd like to know what numbers we have to motivate this as well.

Interesting read on the matter: http://manuel.bernhardt.io/2016/08/09/akka-anti-patterns-flat-actor-hierarchies-or-mixing-business-logic-and-failure-handling/. Relevant docu: http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka/2.4.9/general/supervision.html#supervision

Maybe this exact problem should be solved by supervision (e.g. restarting the connector completely)?

Thanks for pointing that out @rabbah. Implemented the whole change (gradle + ansible + invoker). The last commit can be removed from the PR.

The tests don't need to use a prefix at all, as there will be a local, untagged version.
Patch in #1038.
Commits reorganized and squashed. PG1-238 approved.

Proposed patched:

```
--- a/core/dispatcher/src/main/scala/whisk/core/container/ContainerPool.scala
+++ b/core/dispatcher/src/main/scala/whisk/core/container/ContainerPool.scala
@@ -455,10 +455,12 @@ class ContainerPool(
         val limits = ActionLimits(TimeLimit(), defaultMemoryLimit, LogLimit())
         val containerName = makeContainerName("warmJsContainer")
         val con = makeGeneralContainer(warmNodejsKey, containerName, imageName, limits)
+        if (con.containerId.isDefined) {
             this.synchronized {
                 introduceContainer(warmNodejsKey, con)
             }
-        info(this, s"ContainerPool: started warm nodejs container")
+            info(this, "started warm nodejs container")
+        } else error(this, "error starting warm container")
         con
     }
```
Sounds related to the 2 min timeout of DataPower documented at https://new-console.ng.bluemix.net/docs/security/index.html#functional-security

Thanks for your report.

To clarify: Are you invoking the action blockingly?
yes
This is specific to Bluemix not openwhisk - moving to appropriate repository.

From out of band exchanges, I recall the doc not found error occurred at the invoker.  The controller does not post activation requests for actions that do not exist. When it does request an activation, it does so by document id and revision. While it's possible for the document to be deleted between the time the activation is posted and when the invoker acts on it, in practice the db compaction does not happen that quickly to where the document no longer exists and a different error is expected any how (there should be a tombstone in place).

I'm not convinced we have enough evidence to call this a bug (a defect where exactly?).
Closing duplicate of #1043.
To summarize: we agreed to remove `--enable` from the CLI for `rules create` and do nothing else. The option should remain available for `rules update`.
We already updated the docs to remove --enable (and state that rules are enabled by default). Is this ready to close or is there more planned?
one unintended consequence of this PR: `post` can become more than just posting message. the user can pass any api method as the url. we may wish to leverage this in the future.

An initial implementation was done in #1083. The plan to get the functionality merged into the controller will be structured in the following phases (hence this epic):
1. resolve all sequence components into fully qualified names on action create/update
2. impost a limit on sequence length (and disallow recursion)
3. add entitlement checks to verify access at create/update time to referenced actions
4. implement continuations in controller to process the action sequence

Additional considerations:
1. action timeout for sequence needs to account for remaining slack
2. sequence activation id must be referenced by component activation ids via `caused` property
3. agree on `start` and `end` semantics for the sequence activation (do they exist? or just a duration)

@ioana-blue others to add? I turned this issue into an epic with appropriate issues to be created as needed to complete the work.
@cbickel done?
@jeremiaswerner close? We promoted this fix already.
@csantanapr is there anything specific to do here?
@starpit FYI.

the Bluemix Openwhisk UI supports this for github, and soon for slack (pending https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/pull/1097).

i'm not sure if this is quite possible from the CLI.  oauth token negotiation requires that the user be directed to the provider's oauth initiation web site, so that they may enter their credentials on a trusted site. oauth also often requires a CSRF anti-forgery mechanism, which the backend does not (yet?) support.
@dubeejw @mdeuser done?
@dubeejw can you take a look?

here is a suggestion of how it might look, where the `doclink`` fields are rendered as Learn More anchors.

![github webhook description update](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4741620/17840550/54a0f470-67d8-11e6-8060-8ce68881324e.png)

This is working as designed. The static field is "state" and if your action ends up reusing a container, state from previous invocations carries over to newer ones. You should not count on the container reuse but you can check for it (i.e. using a static). If you don't want this behavior then all static fields should be final and immutable.
OK, thanks. Sounds interesting. Is it documented somewhere?
Need to update https://github.com/openwhisk/openwhisk/blob/master/docs/actions.md#creating-docker-actions
not yet.
Changing title to reflect the actionable work: Document Java
